CLAUDE.md

Source: CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

Commands

Development Commands

  • Build package: devtools::build() or R CMD build .
  • Check package: devtools::check() or R CMD check
  • Run tests: devtools::test() or testthat::test_local()
  • Run specific test: testthat::test_file("tests/testthat/test-dilation.R")
  • Install package: devtools::install() or R CMD INSTALL
  • Load for development: devtools::load_all()
  • Document: devtools::document() to update NAMESPACE and man files from roxygen2 comments

Architecture Overview

This R package provides a unified framework for neuroimaging atlases and parcellations with the following design:

Core Atlas System

The package centers around an S3 object system where all atlases inherit from a base atlas class defined in atlas.R. Key generic functions provide a consistent interface: - get_roi(): Extract specific regions from any atlas - map_atlas(): Map values to atlas regions - reduce_atlas(): Combine regions within an atlas - merge_atlases(): Combine multiple atlases

Atlas Types

  1. Schaefer (schaefer.R): Cortical parcellations with 100-1000 regions, supporting both 7 and 17 network organizations. Available in volume and surface formats.
  2. Glasser (glasser.R): 360-region multi-modal cortical parcellation
  3. ASEG (aseg_subcort.R): FreeSurfer subcortical segmentation
  4. Olsen MTL (olsen_mtl.R): Specialized medial temporal lobe atlas with hippocampal subfields

TemplateFlow Integration

The template_flow.R module bridges to Python’s TemplateFlow API via reticulate. Key points:

Main Functions: - get_template(): Primary interface for fetching templates - Parameters: space (template name), variant (brain/head/mask/probseg/dseg), modality (T1w/T2w), resolution - Supports vectorization on single parameters - Returns NeuroVol objects or paths - create_templateflow(): Initialize TemplateFlow connection - tflow_spaces(): List available templates - tflow_files(): Query available files

Common Issues & Solutions: - Python not installed: Run reticulate::py_available() to check - TemplateFlow module missing: Run neuroatlas::install_templateflow() - Network issues: Function .check_templateflow_connectivity() tests connection - Cache location: Use show_templateflow_cache_path() to find cache

Important Notes: - Deprecated functions (e.g., get_template_legacy()) redirect to new API - Python initialization handled automatically via .init_templateflow_api() - Caching occurs at both R (memoise) and Python (disk) levels - Environment variable TEMPLATEFLOW_HOME managed automatically

Visualization

Integration with the ggseg ecosystem enables brain visualization through ggschaefer.R and plot methods in atlas_methods.R.

Key Dependencies

  • neuroim2: Core neuroimaging data structures
  • neurosurf: Surface-based operations
  • ggseg ecosystem: Brain visualization
  • reticulate: Python interoperability for TemplateFlow
  • rflann: Fast nearest neighbor search

The package follows standard R package conventions with S3 methods documented under their generic functions.
